# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(d -> year(d)*100 + month(d), df.dt)
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym`. The mapping operation uses the `map` function to apply a function to every element in the `dt` column of the DataFrame. This function extracts the year and month from each DateTime, concatenates them into an integer in the format "yyyymm", and assigns this value to the new `:ym` column.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will create a new column `:ym` in the `df` DataFrame with values "202101" and "202202", respectively.
